meanings.definition: The amount of freedom to move or act that is available.
meanings.sent1: She gave her students some leeway to choose their own topics for the project.
meanings.sent2: The boss allowed a little leeway in the deadline for the report.
meanings.sent3: The leeway given to the puppy to explore the yard led to a messy adventure.
meanings.sent4: With a bit of leeway, the artist's creativity soared to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The leeway to make decisions independently empowered the team members.

meanings.definition: An allowance for error or miscalculation.
meanings.sent1: Always leave some leeway in your budget for unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent2: The chef added extra leeway in the recipe to account for variations in taste.
meanings.sent3: The leeway for mistakes in the plan saved the team from a major setback.
meanings.sent4: Having leeway in negotiations can lead to better outcomes for both parties.
meanings.sent5: The leeway for adjustments made the project more adaptable to changes.

meanings.definition: The sideways drift of a ship or aircraft to leeward of the desired course.
meanings.sent1: The captain corrected the ship's leeway to stay on course.
meanings.sent2: Pilots must account for leeway when navigating through strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected leeway of the aircraft caused a delay in arrival.
meanings.sent4: The leeway of the boat made it challenging to reach the intended destination.
meanings.sent5: Navigating the leeway of the ship required skill and precision.
